title: Private Insurance Guide for Autism
description: Private health insurance has become an essential resource for families seeking autism services in Florida, thanks to state and federal laws that mandate coverage for autism spectrum disorder treatments. Florida's autism insurance law, along with the federal Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act, requires most private insurance plans to cover autism services at the same level as other medical conditions, eliminating many of the historical barriers to accessing ABA therapy and related treatments. When evaluating private insurance options for autism coverage, families should carefully review several key factors including whether ABA therapy is covered, annual or lifetime caps on therapy services, prior authorization requirements, in-network provider availability, out-of-pocket costs (deductibles, copays, coinsurance), and coverage for diagnostic evaluations and related services. Most private insurance plans in Florida now cover Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy, speech therapy, occupational therapy, physical therapy, diagnostic evaluations, and mental health services for autism, though the specifics vary significantly by insurance carrier and plan type. Prior authorization is typically required before beginning ABA therapy, involving submission of a comprehensive treatment plan by a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) that demonstrates medical necessity and outlines treatment goals.
